title: TREK bikes logo font
content:
Hi everybody I would like to know what are the font they use for the new TREK bikes logo.

And also what they use for "WORLD RACING"...

Thanks a lot :-)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [trek.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031221248/http:/typophile.com/files/trek.jpg) | 9.14 KB |
author: Actarus

comments.content:
WORLD RACING looks like Avant Garde Gothic. I think we have talked about the TREK logo before, and I think it was custom, but you can search the site for that thread.

- Mike Yanega

[Here](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031221248/http:/www.typophile.com/node/6612) is the thread on the logo lettering.

- Mike Yanega

Hello from Trek,

As previously asserted here on Typophile, the Trek wordmark is custom typography. It was designed by Joe Sutter, formerly of Milwaukee's Hanson Dodge + Sutter, who found inspiration in the classic Honda logotype. Having worked on the identity for our new world cup mountain bike team, I can confirm that _WORLD RACING_ is indeed set in Herb Lubalin's Avant Garde Gothic— [ITC Avant Garde Gothic Std Book](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031221248/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/itc/itc_avant_garde_gothic_by_adobe_std_book/) to be more specific.

Ken

Thanks ;-)

I haven't seen the past post, sorry.

Thanks for the confirmation Ken. It's always good to hear from the sources.

- Mike Yanega
